meanings.definition: To throw stones at someone or something as a form of punishment.
meanings.sent1: The angry mob was stoning the thief for stealing.
meanings.sent2: People used to practice stoning as a punishment long ago.
meanings.sent3: The children were playfully stoning the scarecrow in the field.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain was stoning the roof all night long.
meanings.sent5: The protesters were stoning the government building in protest.

meanings.definition: The act of hitting someone or something with stones.
meanings.sent1: The stoning of the windows caused them to shatter.
meanings.sent2: The ancient punishment of stoning was brutal.
meanings.sent3: The stoning of the cake with colorful candies made it look festive.
meanings.sent4: The stoning of the car's windshield left it cracked.
meanings.sent5: The stoning of the statue by vandals was a disgraceful act.

meanings.definition: A method of execution by throwing stones at a person until they die.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, stoning is still used as a form of punishment.
meanings.sent2: The condemned criminal faced the crowd during his stoning.
meanings.sent3: The stoning of the garden gnome with pebbles was a prank.
meanings.sent4: The stoning of the sky with shooting stars was a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The historical accounts describe the brutal stoning of prisoners in public squares.
